dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

reasonForUpdate.simplePara: Clarification of use of sequential lists: "Only one sequential list must be placed under a numbered title or paragraph (subheading)".

structureObjectRule.objectUse: The root element of an interchanged data module must be element /dmodule/ (Chap 3.9.5).

Company or organization must be indicated by at least one of either the name of the company and/or the companyâ€™s CAGE code, .... However, if a responsible partner company has an enterprise code, then that code must be used (Chap 3.9.5.1, Para 2.2.5).
RFU must not be used on Issue 001 of a data module (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 2.1).
Data modules that are not of issue type changed must also have at least one reason for update element if the issue number is greater than 001 (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 2.2).

If attribute updateHighlight is set to the value 1, this indicates that the reason for update must appear in the highlights data module. If the attribute is not used or its value is 0, it means that the reason for update must not appear in the highlights data module (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 2.2).
The element /changeInline/ must not be used to indicate that a complete element has been inserted (or modified) (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 2.3.3).
There must be no cross-references to deleted information in the data module (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 2.5.2).
There must be no cross-references to deleted information in other data modules (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 2.5.2).
If the element /figure/ is change marked, the change attributes on the element /graphic/ of multi-sheet figures must not be used (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 2.9.1).
Editorial changes must not be marked (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 3).
No change markers must appear if the issue type is not changed (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.1, Para 3.0).
When the reference target is a figure then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be figure (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a table then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be table (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is multimedia (containing one or more objects) then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be multimedia (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a supply then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be supply (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is support equipment then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be supequip (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a spare then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be spares (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a paragraph then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be para (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a step then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be step (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a graphic then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be graphic (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a single multimedia object then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be multimediaobject (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a hotspot then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be hotspot (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
When the reference target is a parameter then the value of attribute internalRefTargetType must be param (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2, Para 2.1).
Sequential (ordered) lists are limited to a maximum of two levels (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.3, Para 2.1).
Sequential lists must not be used to provide procedural step information. (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.3, Para 2.1).
Only one sequential (ordered) list must be placed under a numbered title or paragraph (subheading) (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.3, Para 2.1).
In procedural, process, crew and fault data modules, titles must be included for /table/ for formal tables. (Chap 3.9.5.2.1.5, Para 2).
The depth of the /levelledPara/ structure is unlimited, however, it is recommended to not exceed five levels of depth (Chap 3.9.5.2.2, Para 2.1).
The subparagraph breakdown must never exceed eight levels of depth. (Chap 3.9.5.2.2, Para 2.1).
It is highly discouraged to exceed five levels of depth for proceduralStep. (Chap 3.9.5.2.3, Para 2.6.1).
The procedural substep breakdown must never exceed eight levels of depth (Chap 3.9.5.2.3, Para 2.6.1).
Attribute sparePartClassCode - Spare part class (Chap 3.9.5.2.11.3, Para 2.1.1.4.1)
Attribute itemLocationCode - Data module item location (Chap 4.3.8, Para 2.1)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Information related to items installed on the Product
Information related to items installed on a major assembly removed from the Product
Information related to items on the bench
Information related to all three locations A, B, and C
The data module contains training information

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute learnCode - the first character of the learn code must be set to either "H" for human performance technology codes or "T" for training codes (Chap 4.3.9, Para 2; Chap 8.5).
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Terminal objective - Intellectual skill - Higher order rules
Enabling objective - Intellectual skill- Higher order rules
Static content - Higher order rule Expositive
Short answer free text Fill in the blank

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute learnEventCode - Used to store the learn event code (Chap 4.3.10, Para 1).
Whenever a learn code is used, the learn event code must be used (Chap 4.3.10, Para 1).
There are [at the most] three levels of random list (Chap 6.2.2, Para 2.6.2.1).
Attribute infoCode - The data module information code (Chap 8.4.1).
Attribute accessPointTypeValue - Access point (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 2)
Attribute acronymType - Type of acronym or abbreviation (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 3)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Spec (Candidate for list of applicable specs)

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute cancelCaption - Caption for dialog cancel function (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 4)
Attribute caveat - National caveat (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 5)
Attribute checkListCategory - Check list category (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 6)
Attribute color - Caption color (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 7)
Attribute commentPriorityCode - Priority level of a comment (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 8)
Attribute commercialClassification - Commercial security classification (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 9)
Attribute crewMemberType - Type of crew member required for drill or procedural step (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 10)
Attribute crewStepCondition - Crew step condition (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 11)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: A detailed procedure for the step is located in the performance section of the condensed checklist
Performance of the step is mandatory for all through-flights used for combat/tactical operations
A step that is mandatory for night flights
A task or step required by the operator manual

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute descrForItemCode - IPD item description code (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 12)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: None of the Other Codes Applies

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute drillType - Type of aircrew drill (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 13)
Attribute emphasisType - Type of emphasis (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 14)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Italic (only for legacy data, see Chap 3.9.1)
Underline (only for legacy data, see Chap 3.9.1)
Strikethrough (not to be used to mark deleted text)

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute function - Maintenance function (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 15)
Attribute installationLocationType - Type of install location (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 16)
Attribute itemCharacteristic - Item characteristic (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 17)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Step related to hardness critical process
Step with a quality assurance effect

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute itemOriginator - Origin of equipment/harness/wire (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 18)
Attribute limitUnitType - Limit type (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 19)
Attribute listItemPrefix - Prefix for list items of random/unordered lists (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 20)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Unorder (Depending on list level, prefix with short dash for first level, bullet for second, and short dash for third level - ISOpub: bull, dash)
Disc (filled circle in circle - ISOamsb: ocir)

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute lowestLevel - Lowest authorized level (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 21)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Field/ASB maintenance can remove, replace, and use the item.
Below depot sustainment maintenance can remove, replace, and use the item.
Specialized repair activity/TASMG can remove, replace, and use the item.
Afloat and ashore intermediate maintenance can remove, replace, and use the item.
Contractor facility can remove, replace, and use the item.
Item is not authorized to be removed, replace, or used at any maintenance level
Depot can remove, replace, and use the item.

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute maintLevelCode - Maintenance Level Code (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 22)
Attribute partCharacteristic - Part characteristic (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 23)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Flight safety and critical aircraft part

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute pmEntryType - Publication module entry type (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 24)
Attribute quantityType - Quantity data type (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 25)
Attribute reqCondCategory - Required condition category (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 26)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Special environmental conditions such as reduced lighting, ventilation, and temperature.

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute reqTechInfoCategory - Required technical information category (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 27)
Attribute resetCaption - Caption for dialog reset caption (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 28)
Attribute responseType - Type of response to a comment (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 29)
Attribute securityClassification - Security classification (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 30)
Attribute significantParaDataType - Paragraph significant data type (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 31)
Attribute skillLevelCode - Personnel skill level (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 32)
Attribute skillType - Personnel skill category (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 33)
Attribute sourceCriticality - Source criticality (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 34)
Attribute sourceTypeCode - Source type code (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 35)
Attribute submitCaption - Caption for dialog submit function (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 36)
Attribute supervisorLevelCode - Supervisor level (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 37)
Attribute taskCode - Task code (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 38)
Attribute thresholdUnitOfMeasure - Unit of measurement for the threshold interval (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 39)
Attribute updateReasonType - Update reason type for reason for update (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 40)
structureObjectRule.objectValue: Editorial change (authored/technical content changed, but technically changes are deemed insignificant)
Technical change (authored/technical content has changed, changes are significant and should be reviewed)
Markup change (changes are solely related to XML markup)
Applicability change (only the applicability has changed)
Unique identifier of the referencing structure has changed

structureObjectRule.objectUse: Attribute verbatimStyle - Verbatim style (Chap 3.9.6.1, Table 41)
